modName: Noldorian Ancient Falmer Armor UNP UNPB others
summary: This mod offers a quality makeover of the Ancient Falmer Armor from the Dawnguard DLC which perfectly complements my popular Noldorian Auriel's Bow and Shield mods.
descriptionHtml:
[font=century gothic][color=Green][u][b][size=+3]Noldorian Ancient Falmer Armor[/size][/b][/u][/color][/font]




[font=century gothic][color=YELLOW][u][b][size=+2]About this Mod[/size][/b][/u][/color][/font]


[size=+1][color=lightblue]This mod offers a lore friendly quality makeover, including brand new HD leather textures of the Ancient Falmer Armor from the Dawnguard DLC which perfectly complements my popular [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/29329]Noldorian Auriels Bow[/url]
and [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/30100]Noldorian Auriels Shield[/url] mods.

I have included two optional versions which offer lore friendly body conversions for UNP and UNPB body replacers, but the main version should be compatible with every mesh replacer out there which uses the vanilla Ancient Falmer Armor textures, including skimpy versions.

The textures of the main version are quite big, but can be used without problems as all of my various testers have reported. I chose to keep them uncompressed for the best possible texture quality and look. A performance version will be added soon if required, but I really recommend to use the main uncompressed version.

About the looks of it images can say more than thousand words of mine - especially since I had the honour to be able to get some of the greatest screenarchers on the Nexus as beta testers for my work. Be sure to check out their remarkable work in the gallery on this front page and in the image section of this mod.[/size][/color]


[font=century gothic][color=YELLOW][u][b][size=+2]Requirements[/size][/b][/u][/color][/font]


[size=+1][color=lightblue]Skyrim 1.8+ and Dawnguard DLC are required for this mod to work.[/size][/color]


[font=century gothic][color=YELLOW][u][b][size=+2]Installation[/size][/b][/u][/color][/font]


[size=+1][color=lightblue]Download the mod file and extract the file into your skyrim directory, e.g. C:Program Files (x86)SteamSteamAppscommonskyrimData and say "yes" when being asked to integrate and override.

[/size][/color]


[font=century gothic][color=YELLOW][u][b][size=+2]Un-installation[/size][/b][/u][/color][/font]


[size=+1][color=lightblue]Delete the file via NMM or manually by deleting the files contained in the mod folder within your Skyrim "Textures" folder.[/size][/color]


[font=century gothic][color=YELLOW][u][b][size=+2]Compatibility[/size][/b][/u][/color][/font]


[size=+1][color=lightblue]This mod is compatible with everything except mods that alter the TEXTURES of the Ancient Falmer Armor[/size][/color]

[font=century gothic][color=YELLOW][u][b][size=+2]Credits[/size][/b][/u][/color][/font]


[size=+1][color=lightblue]Credits go to...

- Exeter for the UNP and UNPB meshes -> check out his [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/22033]body conversion mod[/url]
- Bethesda for creating the gaming masterpiece Skyrim, Dawnguard DLC and the HD texture packs
- Professor Tolkien who made a fact-loving lawyer and historician believe in magic again, the day I discovered his unique and ever outstanding work back in 2001
- Peter Jackson and WETA Workshop for being a great inspiration for this mod
- Lana del Rey, Howard Shore, Harry Gregson-Williams, Richard Wagner, Giacomo Puccini and others for helping me through endless hours of modding work

and last but absolutely not least to my fantastic group of friends and beta testers :[/size][/color]

[font=century gothic][color=YELLOW][u][b][size=+2]Permissions[/size][/b][/u][/color][/font]


[size=+1][color=lightblue]You are not allowed to use any assets of this mod whithout my permission.[/size][/color]

[font=century gothic][color=YELLOW][u][b][size=+2]Author's note[/size][/b][/u][/color][/font]


[size=+1][color=lightblue]If you like this mod please take a second to show your apprechiation and endorse it, leave a comment or load up a picture - I'd be really grateful for it, since I have put many hours of work and a lot of determination into it. If you enjoy a mod a few clicks should not be too much to ask for. If you face any issues please let me know, so that we may find a solution.[/size][/color]
author: EcthelionOtW
